definitions.definition: To rise from a lying or sitting position.
definitions.example: Stand up, then sit down again.

definitions.definition: To bring something up and set it into a standing position.
definitions.example: Laura stood the sofa up on end.

definitions.definition: (stand someone up) To avoid a prearranged meeting, especially a date, with (a person) without prior notification; to jilt or shirk.
definitions.example: John stood Laura up at the movie theater.

definitions.definition: (of a thing) To last or endure over a period of time.
(of a person or narrative) To continue to be believable, consistent, or plausible.
(of a wicket-keeper) To stand immediately behind the wicket so as to catch balls from a slow or spin bowler, and to attempt to stump the batsman.
To formally activate and commission (a unit, formation, etc.).
To make one's voice heard, to speak up
